topics.body: For some reason that currently escapes me, I'm currently watching the first episode of the Battle of the planets dub of Gatchaman.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
That wasn't nearly as painful as I was expecting.

Because of this, I have decided to judge these kinds of things on their own merits. And to take the time of production into context. (The most important part of those kinds of dubs is carrying the same basic feel as the source material.)

Checking out Voltron, Saber rider and the star sheriffs, And Robotech.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
You know; I thought of something; I think the ghost in the shell movie might actually be good.


Historically speaking once in a while Disney has these little farts of creativity that people always seem to remember as part of their childhood, but the problem with Disney's creativity is that historically speaking they have a habit of milking things to death which is why there's for every good Disney movie a god awful one cause they milk it and milk it and milk it to the point that even when there's nothing left they continue to try to milk it.

What do I mean by this?  For the next couple of years I wouldn't be surprised if the Disney movies are good, but chances are they're going to fuck it up by eventually making Avengers 8, Toy Story 7, Ghost in the Shell 5 (and have it completely unrelated to anything remotely ghost in the shell by then), etc.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
